meanings.definition: Originating or formed below the surface of the earth.
meanings.sent1: The miners discovered a hypogene rock deep underground.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the hypogene formation beneath the soil.
meanings.sent3: The hypogene roots of the tree seemed to reach the center of the earth!
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as hypogene as the hidden gems in the earth's core.
meanings.sent5: The hypogene layers of rock were like buried secrets waiting to be uncovered.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to minerals formed at great depths within the earth's crust.
meanings.sent1: The geologist explained the hypogene minerals found in the deep layers.
meanings.sent2: Miners were amazed by the hypogene deposits they unearthed.
meanings.sent3: The hypogene crystals sparkled like hidden treasures in the dark.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as hypogene as the precious stones deep in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The hypogene minerals were like rare jewels hidden beneath the surface.
